title: @Meddler, so 6.23 is going to be the patch you'll dedicate to changing certain champs, right?
body:
You already affirmed Shyvana's getting changes
I'm still crossing my fingers for Morde 

But the one I actually want to talk about is none other than the Terror Beneath, the Void Burrower, League's fairest Lady
REK'SAI!

Now we can all agree that release Rek'sai was a monster in more ways than one, having strong damage, durability, map pressure, utility and more.
She was simply too good at a lot of things but ever since her release she was nerfed... A LOT, like she only received nerfs in the time since her release, turning her into nothing more than a competitive knock-up bot.

And as great as knocking something up feels like in the end it may bite you in the ass and have long term implications on you.
You'll be forced to give up some of the things you took for granted like time, money....or other strengths like damage and co.

Her play style has become really binary and she tends to build mostly tank instead of a mix, being a bruiser to be feared rather than a meat shield.

You mentioned  looking into ways to make her build more like a bruiser and make her more satisfying to play so can we expect these type of changes in the next PBE cycle or were they scrapped?
It's a shame seeing champions being nerfed just because they're oppressive in pro play.
Shifting her kit around and making her more satisfying for casuals and less binary in pro play would really go a long way in making her a great champion again.

http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/RekSai_1.jpg

And the worst part is that today I saw a Rioter saying that Azir is the most broken champion in the game and that he will be on the dumpster untill he gets some changes.
Except Azir is the most broken kit wise and should be dumbstered until they change him. I'm sorry but facts are facts.
http://s2.quickmeme.com/img/55/5534dc946c381785cfd458a6b5e0b7f027762bbe430c1491b00d7c9eed0781d0.jpg

He has the longest attack range in the game with his W. Zoning with his Q. Free 50% attack speed. His E gives him the longest non-ultimate dash, and *an ultimate that CC's in a large AoE, zones entire enemy teams, deals damage, blocks dashes, peels off all melee champions*.

Keep in mind he has the greatest self peel ability and the longest dash that not even Olaf can chase him down.

He is gutted like hell right now.  He has a 43.5% winrate.  If you aren't an OTP Azir main, you're going to fail.  His kit is very high skill.  His E giving him a dash?  You need to sacrifice your main source of damage.  Your ultimate that CC's enemies?  Walk out of it.  Unless he does some kind of insec play, you'll be fine.  And in soloq, you don't have team coordination to take advantage of an insec.  Karthus has a global, undodgeable nuke?  So what?  His kit is trash right now.  Stick a Tankko on him and even Azir can't get away with all that sticking power.  And Tankko isn't rare at all.

Well yeah, Azir is gutted completely because his kit is so overpowered.

Similarly, Karthus' ult is what keeps him from getting meaningful buffs.

Except Azir only dashed in, meaning he needs to Q just to move it to damage, or out, meaning who cares if he wastes his damage, he's already out of whatever bad situation.

I'm sorry, op and broken are two different things.
OP means their numbers are high **and that's it.**  Kind of like if Teemo got a superbuff.
Broken means the kit itself is inherently unbalanced.  Think double skills ~~like Gnar~~.  It's where they are hard to balance since their kit is extremely feast/famine.  
With that being said, Azir's kit is not the most broken.  There are more overloaded champions such as Gnar or Ekko who have so many special interactions.  Gnar can buy {{item:3085}} and {{item:3074}} because he is both melee and ranged.  Azir is nothing special.  Yes he has a great all in, but if he messes up, he's screwed.  Ekko can just ult back for an undo button.

No, OP and broken are synonyms. Overpowered means to be massively above average. Broken is an exaggeration.

Downvoting comments because you don't like the truth is pretty mean.

Oh and Azir is the most broken kite wise, Kalista second. Ekko already got gutted and needs some reverts or else his PBE version cannot jungle at all. Gnar just got powercreeped out.

*Prepares for stream of downvotes*
In all seriousness, the two terms have come to being used simultaneously.  An OP kit is a kit with overtuned numbers or that is easily abused.  A broken kit is overloaded.  Often times overloaded is synonymous with being OP simply because of the utility it brings to the table.
Overloaded means *has too much*. Similarly, many overloaded champions happen to be very overpowered because they out utility other champions.
I think he mixed up "broken" and "unhealthy"

Since map awareness is a big part of her concept, because of her global ult, that would force you to stay out of burrowed stance almost entirely. Doesn't fit the concept.

And it would hurt her team fighting potential alot. Right now, in a team fight you can use the vision of your team members to use your knock up at full potential. Wouldn't be possible in your version.

Would Rek'sai be better if the knockup was simply removed and there was a better slow added to her Q? This seems like people would then be forced to build more damage on her because her utility would be worse, sort of like a lighter Shyvana with better mobility. I would also like to see some changes to this champ as I feel she just isn't worth selecting for me at this point.

The real issue is knock ups. There is little counter play other then to dodge it. It is like a mini suppression. You can't build to lower the duration (height of knock up). The only way to balance it is a skill shot but Jenna and yasou have proven how strong it is as a skill shot. Jenna has no damage and is still a great support with her shield and knock up.
